commits.message:
Add install command (#13081)

<!--- 
Thanks so much for your contribution! If this is your first time
contributing, please ensure that you have read the
[CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
documentation.
-->

# Description

<!--- Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed.
Please also include relevant motivation and context. -->

Fixes https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/issues/10990.

This also includes a couple of fixes for python to get the
`TestLanguageConvertComponentSmoke` test working for it.
Firstly it fixes InstallDependencies to not create a venv if no venv
path is set. The language host was trying to install a venv to the same
directory as the program itself (that is not nested under "venv" or the
like). But then because the runtime option wasn't set the execution
wasn't using that created venv anyway.

Secondly the imports for components are not relative. We're not in a
proper module when running a python program so relative imports to
side-by-side component folders don't work.

## Checklist

- [x] I have run `make tidy` to update any new dependencies
- [x] I have run `make lint` to verify my code passes the lint check
  - [x] I have formatted my code using `gofumpt`

<!--- Please provide details if the checkbox below is to be left
unchecked. -->

feature works
<!--- 
User-facing changes require a CHANGELOG entry.
-->
- [x] I have run `make changelog` and committed the
`changelog/pending/<file>` documenting my change

Prepare for v3.91.0 release (#14343)

### Features

- [cli] Adds a new `pulumi install` command which will install packages
and plugins for a project.
[#13081](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/13081)


### Bug Fixes

- [engine] Fix generation of property paths in diff.
  [#14337](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/14337)

Freeze v3.91.0 (#14408)

### Features

- [cli] Adds a new `pulumi install` command which will install packages
and plugins for a project.
[#13081](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/13081)


### Bug Fixes

- [engine] Fix generation of property paths in diff.
  [#14337](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/14337)

Changelog and go.mod updates for v3.91.0 (#14411)

Co-authored-by: github-actions <github-actions@github.com>

stack ls: remove misleading updateInProgress output for file backend (#14309)

File backends currently do not support indicating whether an operation
is currently in progress or not. In the `stack ls --json` output we
always end up with a "updateInProgress = false" field, even when an
update is in progress. This is misleading.

Disable showing this erroneous and misleading output.

Fixes #10677

Based on Luke's comments in that issue, I believe we should merge this
as bug fix for the issue, and then open a separate feature request
tracking the implementation of tracking whether an update is in progress
in the file backend.

## Checklist

plain imports.

issue.title: [filestate backend] Pulumi stack ls --json always returns updateInProgress False, even when there is actually an update in progress

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Some behavior is incorrect or out of spec

labels.name: area/cli
labels.description: UX of using the CLI (args, output, logs)

labels.name: area/backends
labels.description: State storage (filestate/httpstate/etc.)

labels.name: resolution/fixed
labels.description: This issue was fixed

issue.body:
### What happened?

When running `pulumi stack ls --json` the returned field updateInProgress is always False, even when an update is taking place

### Steps to reproduce

Run: `pulumi up`
Meanwhile pulumi is updating the stack run: `pulumi stack ls --json`

You can run multiple times the command `pulumi stack ls --json` meanwhile the update is going through and it will never show True in the updateInProgress field

### Expected Behavior

Expected output:
```
[
  {
    "name": "dev",
    "current": true,
    "lastUpdate": "2022-09-12T11:41:08.686Z",
    "updateInProgress": true,
    "resourceCount": 3
  }
]
```

### Actual Behavior

Actual output:
```
[
  {
    "name": "dev",
    "current": true,
    "lastUpdate": "2022-09-12T11:41:08.686Z",
    "updateInProgress": false,
    "resourceCount": 3
  }
]
```

### Output of `pulumi about`

```
CLI          
Version      3.39.3
Go Version   go1.19.1
Go Compiler  gc

Plugins
NAME          VERSION
azure-native  1.67.0
python        unknown

Host     
OS       ubuntu
Version  20.04
Arch     x86_64

This project is written in python: executable='/anaconda/envs/py38_default/bin/python3' version='3.8.13
'

Current Stack: dev

Found no resources associated with dev

Found no pending operations associated with dev

Backend        
Name           ruizfad001
URL            file://~/pulumifirststeps/backend
User           ruizfad
Organizations  

Dependencies:
NAME                 VERSION
pip                  22.2.2
pulumi-azure-native  1.67.0
setuptools           63.4.2
wheel                0.37.1

Pulumi locates its logs in /tmp by default
```

### Additional context

_No response_

### Contributing

Vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction. 
To contribute a fix for this issue, leave a comment (and link to your pull request, if you've opened one already).

comment.body: I just merged the changes to no longer display the `updateInProgress` field in the json output if we are using filestate backends, so I think we can consider the bug fixed.  This still leaves the feature request, and I opened https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/issues/14423 to track that.

labels.name: area/cli
labels.description: UX of using the CLI (args, output, logs)

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: Improvements or new features

labels.name: area/backends
labels.description: State storage (filestate/httpstate/etc.)

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: Needs attention from the triage team

issue.body:
## Hello!
<!-- Please leave this section as-is, it's designed to help others in the community know how to interact with our GitHub issues. -->

- Vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction
- If you want to implement this feature, comment to let us know (we'll work with you on design, scheduling, etc.)

## Issue details

Filestate backends currently don't support checking whether there is an update in progress or not.  It would be useful for some users to have this support implemented.

For further background see also https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/issues/10677.

### Affected area/feature

Filestate backend; `pulumi stack ls --json` output

pull_request.title: stack ls: remove misleading updateInProgress output for file backend
pull_request.body:
File backends currently do not support indicating whether an operation is currently in progress or not.  In the `stack ls --json` output we always end up with a "updateInProgress = false" field, even when an update is in progress.  This is misleading.

Disable showing this erroneous and misleading output.

Fixes #10677

Based on Luke's comments in that issue, I believe we should merge this as bug fix for the issue, and then open a separate feature request tracking the implementation of tracking whether an update is in progress in the file backend.

stack ls: remove misleading updateInProgress output for file backend (#14309)

File backends currently do not support indicating whether an operation
is currently in progress or not. In the `stack ls --json` output we
always end up with a "updateInProgress = false" field, even when an
update is in progress. This is misleading.

Disable showing this erroneous and misleading output.

Fixes #10677

Based on Luke's comments in that issue, I believe we should merge this
as bug fix for the issue, and then open a separate feature request
tracking the implementation of tracking whether an update is in progress
in the file backend.

issue.body:
### What happened?

### Example

n/a

### Output of `pulumi about`

n/a

### Additional context

_No response_

### Contributing

Vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction. 
To contribute a fix for this issue, leave a comment (and link to your pull request, if you've opened one already).

comment.body:
I'm having issues with this since update to v3.90.0. some logs:

```
Diagnostics:
  pulumi:pulumi:Stack (python-dev):
    error: Program failed with an unhandled exception:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/home/runner/work/python/python/infra/__main__.py", line 2, in <module>
        from functions.function import Permissions, function_deploy
      File "/home/runner/work/python/python/infra/functions/function.py", line 34, in <module>
        from common_infra.app_registration import client_id, tenant_id
      File "/home/runner/work/python/python/infra/common_infra/app_registration.py", line 6, in <module>
        app = Application.get("app-registration", object_id)
              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
      File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.11.6/x64/lib/python3.11/site-packages/pulumi_azuread/application.py", line 1934, in get
        return Application(resource_name, opts=opts, __props__=__props__)
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
      File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.11.6/x64/lib/python3.11/site-packages/pulumi_azuread/application.py", line 1693, in __init__
        ApplicationArgs._configure(_setter, **kwargs)
    TypeError: ApplicationArgs._configure() missing 1 required positional argument: 'display_name'
```

issue.title: Contributing Instructions are Out of Date

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Some behavior is incorrect or out of spec

labels.name: area/docs
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

labels.name: resolution/fixed
labels.description: This issue was fixed

issue.body:
### What happened?

I'm attempting to follow the guidelines under [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md). However, the instructions to [install on macOS](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#installing-pulumi-dependencies-on-macos) appear out of date.

```fish
brew install --HEAD -s dotnet-sdk.rb
```
This operation yields the error:

```text
Error: Calling Cask::DSL::Version#before_colon is disabled! Use Cask::DSL::Version#csv instead.
```

### Steps to reproduce

On a Mac with Brew installed, follow the instructions to [install Pulumi dependencies.](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#installing-pulumi-dependencies-on-macos)

```
brew install node python@3 typescript yarn go@1.17 golangci/tap/golangci-lint pulumi/tap/pulumictl coreutils
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/0272f0d33f/Casks/dotnet-sdk.rb > dotnet-sdk.rb  # v3.1.0
brew install --HEAD -s dotnet-sdk.rb
rm dotnet-sdk.rb
```

### Expected Behavior

I expected the dotnet runtime/compiler to be successfully installed.

### Actual Behavior

Homebrew threw an error:

```text
Error: Calling Cask::DSL::Version#before_colon is disabled! Use Cask::DSL::Version#csv instead.
```

### Versions used

Fish shell v3.2.2

### Additional context

I'll ask in Slack if anyone else has encountered this. If not, I'll explore workarounds and attempt to determine the root of the problem.

### Contributing

Vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction. 
To contribute a fix for this issue, leave a comment (and link to your pull request, if you've opened one already).

comment.body: I have got the same issue after one year. So What can I do at this time? @mikhailshilkov

issue.title: After Upgrading to Pulumi 3.88.0, aliasURNs are not longer populated for Mocks

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Some behavior is incorrect or out of spec

labels.name: area/sdks
labels.description: Pulumi language SDKs

issue.body:
### What happened?

We upgraded from 3.87.0 to 3.88.0 and one of our mock tests that check for aliases stopped working. We use the following code to populate mocks. 

```python
class MockResourceDetails:
    urn: str
    aliases: List[str]
    parent: str
    name: str
    protect: bool
    type: str
    importId: str
    dependencies: List[str]

    def __init__(self, request: Any, response: Any) -> None:
        # Coerce to strings. We don't want the protocol buffer types.
        # They cannot easily be serialized to json/yaml.
        self.urn = f"{response.urn}"
        self.aliases = list(map(lambda x: f"{x}", request.aliasURNs))
        self.dependencies = list(map(lambda x: f"{x}", request.dependencies))
        self.name = f"{request.name}"
        self.parent = f"{request.parent}"
        self.type = f"{request.type}"

    def as_dict(self) -> dict:
        return {
            "type": self.type,
            "name": self.name,
            "urn": self.urn,
            "parent": self.parent,
            "dependencies": self.dependencies,
            "aliases": self.aliases,
        }
```
I suspect this is because of #14118

### Example

Working on example.

### Output of `pulumi about`

Pulumi cli - 3.86.0
pulumi-command==0.8.2
pulumi==3.88.0
pulumi_aws==6.6.0
pulumi_cloudinit==1.3.0
pulumi_datadog==4.17.1
pulumi_kubernetes==3.30.2
pulumi_random==4.13.0
pulumi_tls==4.10.0

### Additional context

_No response_

### Contributing

Vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction. 
To contribute a fix for this issue, leave a comment (and link to your pull request, if you've opened one already).

issue.title: Expose additional data from MockResourceArgs

labels.name: area/sdks
labels.description: Pulumi language SDKs

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: Improvements or new features

issue.body:
## Hello!
<!-- Please leave this section as-is, it's designed to help others in the community know how to interact with our GitHub issues. -->

- Vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction
- If you want to implement this feature, comment to let us know (we'll work with you on design, scheduling, etc.)

## Issue details

Some customers writing unit tests with mocks would like to check additional data about resources, such as:
- urn
- aliases
- parent
- protected
- importId
- dependencies

We should consider exposing this extra data from `MockResourceArgs` (e.g. [Python](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/blob/6e94043cfb37ff54832c09b0d69d76ddf1c75f94/sdk/python/lib/pulumi/runtime/mocks.py#L54), [Node](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/blob/6e94043cfb37ff54832c09b0d69d76ddf1c75f94/sdk/nodejs/runtime/mocks.ts#L25), etc.) so there is an officially supported way to get this data, rather than having to use internals of the mocking capability to get at it.

### Affected area/feature

Mocking capability for unit tests.
